meanings.definition: A type of fishing net that is dragged along the bottom of a body of water to catch fish.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen used dragnets to catch a lot of fish in the lake.
meanings.sent2: The dragnets were effective in capturing a variety of fish species.
meanings.sent3: The playful otter got tangled in the dragnets while trying to steal a fish.
meanings.sent4: The dragnets of knowledge scooped up all the information needed for the project.
meanings.sent5: The shiny dragnets shimmered as they glided through the water, ready to trap their prey.

meanings.definition: A method or system used to catch a large number of people or things at once.
meanings.sent1: The police set up dragnets to capture the escaped prisoners quickly.
meanings.sent2: The dragnets of social media gathered a vast audience for the event.
meanings.sent3: The shopping spree felt like falling into a dragnet of discounts and deals.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as dragnets, capturing the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dragnets of fate seemed to entangle all their lives together in unexpected ways.
